newsitem.title: GERMANY: Gold seen poised for upside gains in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Gold seen poised for upside gains in 1997.

text.p: The gold bullion price may be poised for gains towards $374 or $391 per ounce, WestLB bank said in a monthly market circular.
It cited continued short covering and positive chart signals after the market fell to three-year lows at $336 earlier in the year.
It said the projected price targets would only be threatened if the market dropped below the initial 1997 low.
But much hinged on possible sales from European central banks in a bid to meet convergence criteria ahead of currency union.
The report did not say whether the price targets, if reached, would be maintained for lengthy periods.
London gold fixed firmer at $349.85 on Tuesday morning after a four-day market holiday as weaker equity markets were seen providing support.
Silver might rise to 600 cents in 1997 because of a growing supply/demand gap, WestLB also said.
London silver on Tuesday fixed sharply lower at 503.50 cents/lb but remained supported at 500.
The bank noted stocks were at a 46-year low after the last seven years had generated new mining and recycling supply shortfalls against a background of steadily growing demand.
Sooner or later this imbalance would have to be regulated via higher prices since national banks held no silver reserves, WestLB said.
